meanings.definition: Cook (food) for too long or at too high a temperature.
meanings.sent1: I always end up overcooking my pasta and making it too soft.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally overcooked the steak, making it tough and dry.
meanings.sent3: Dad tends to overcook the vegetables until they turn into mush.
meanings.sent4: The chef warned against overcooking the fish, as it would ruin the delicate flavors.
meanings.sent5: The smell of overcooking filled the kitchen, signaling dinner was ready.

meanings.sent1: Overcooking the chicken made it dry and tasteless.
meanings.sent2: If you overcook the eggs, they will become rubbery.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her friend had a talent for overcooking everything he touched.
meanings.sent4: The chef cringed at the thought of overcooking the pasta for the important guests.
meanings.sent5: The risk of overcooking the soup made her constantly check the timer.
